div.p: Box 244/3 Shillinglaw papers, La Trobe Australian manuscripts collection, State Library of Victoria, Melbourne.

I was touched and delighted, dear Mr Shillinglaw, when yesterday I heard of our friend Giles, that you stood up for me in such a manly manner against one of my most powerful adversaries. I have done the man never any harm; contrarily when he went to Philadelphia I wrote kind words about him to the great Asa Gray!
See M to A. Gray, 25 December 1875. The man referred to was G. C. Levey, who was Secretary to the Victorian Exhibition Commissioners at the Philadelphia Centennial Exhibition in 1876.
He knows nothing about me and my Department, absolutely nothing, at least no more than any layman. I feel your generous feeling for rectitude all the more, as I have no claims on your consideration.
